raw_text:
Benitez 'to launch Morientes bid'
 
 Liverpool may launch an £8m January bid for long-time target Fernando Morientes, according to reports.
 
 The Real Madrid striker has been linked with a move to Anfield since the summer and is currently behind Raul, Ronaldo and Michael Owen at the Bernabeu. Liverpool boss Rafael Benitez is keen to bolster his forward options with Djibril Cisse out until next season. "If there is an attractive propostition it could be I would be keen to leave," admitted the 28-year-old Morientes. He added: "Unfortunately, I'm not in control of the situation. I'm under contract to Real and they will make any decisions." The fee could put Liverpool off a prospective deal but Real are keen to net the cash as they are reported to be preparing a massive summer bid for Inter Milan striker Adriano. The Reds are currently sixth in the Premiership, 15 points behind leaders Chelsea.
llama3.2:1b: Liverpool may launch an £8m January bid for Fernando Morientes after reports of interest and Anfield's need for forward options.
Fernando Morientes is a target of Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez who wants to bolster his team with new signings.
Morientes has expressed willingness to join Liverpool, although under contract to Real Madrid, and admits that an attractive offer could lead him out the door if not met.
llama3.2:3b: Liverpool may launch £8m January bid for Fernando Morientes, who is also wanted by Real Madrid, with Benitez looking to bolster forward options due to Djibril Cisse's injury.
gemma2:2b: Liverpool may make an £8 million bid for Fernando Morientes in January.

Real Madrid's Morientes is reportedly willing to leave the club if there's an attractive offer and Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez is looking to strengthen his forward line, but a potential deal could be hindered by Real Madrid's desire to sell Morientes for a large sum as they plan a big summer bid for Inter Milan striker Adriano.

Benitez says he is keen to bolster forward options but notes that Liverpool could be out of the deal if it comes at a lower fee.

Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez admires Morientes' performance but faces opposition from Real Madrid's desire for cash, as they prepare a potential massive summer bid for Inter Milan striker Adriano.
Morientes himself expresses his willingness to leave if an attractive offer comes in, despite being under contract at Real Madrid.
Liverpool currently sit sixth in the Premiership, 15 points behind leaders Chelsea.
